message.content:
cs.DC, cs.MS, cs.PF, cs.AR, cs.NA 

The paper discusses the use of MPI-3, a widely used communication model in High Performance Computing, and evaluates a new remote-memory-access model called DART-MPI. This suggests that the paper could belong to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. The paper also discusses the optimization of communication paths according to the locality of data origin and destination, which could fall under the Memory Systems (cs.MS) sub-category. Additionally, the paper evaluates the performance of the models on a Cray XC40 installation, which could fall under the Performance (cs.PF) and Architecture (cs.AR) sub-categories. Finally, the paper uses a scientific application to evaluate the models, which could fall under the Numerical Analysis (cs.NA) sub-category.
